DIVISION 1. GENERALLY
Sec. 8-81. Required:
It shall be unlawful for any person to own, conduct, manage or exhibit for
gain, within the City, any circus, carnival, theater, game or amusement machine
where money is charged directly or indirectly for admission to see, hear or
operate the same, unless a license for the same shall have first been obtained
from the City. Provided, that the provisions of this section shall not apply to
any public entertainment given, the proceeds of which are for the benefit of
any religious, charitable or educational institution located in the City. (1963
Code art. 6-2(A); Ord. 16-2000, 3-13-2000)
Sec. 8-82. Issuance:
A license under this division may be issued by the City Clerk upon application
and the payment to the City Finance Department of such sum as the Council may
fix in each case, except where the amount of the license fee is specifically
designated herein. (1963 Code art. 6-2(A); Ord. 043-2017, 11-6-2017)
Sec. 8-83. Scope; Duration; Maintenance Of Order:
Every license issued under this division shall specify the object and length of
time for which it is issued. It shall be the duty of the person licensed to
keep good order about his place of entertainment. (1963 Code art. 6-2(A))
Sec. 8-84. Circuses, Carnivals, Etc.:
   (a)   For each circus, carnival or like exhibition, the license fee shall be
twenty five dollars ($25.00) per day.
   (b)   Proprietors of theaters in the City may be licensed for one year, upon
the payment to the City Finance Department as follows:
      (1)   Where the seating capacity is less than 500    $25.00
      (2)   Where the seating capacity is 500 to 1,000    50.00
      (3)   Where the seating capacity is over 1,000      75.00
(1963 Code art. 6-2(A); Ord. 91-14, 2-11-1991; Ord. 92-47, 3-23-1992; Ord. 043-
2017, 11-6-2017)
Sec. 8-85. Automatic Musical Instrument:
(Rep. by Ord. 16-2000, 3-13-2000)
Sec. 8-86. Youth Dance License:
   (a)   Definition; License Required: No person, firm or corporation, either
as owner, lessee, manager, officer or agent, shall operate or permit to be
operated on any premises, including any enclosed or unenclosed structure, and
the surrounding premises used for parking or any activity used for the dancing
operation in the City for a dance club where an admission is charged and where
any of the participants are under the age of twenty one (21) without first
obtaining a license for use of said premises for said purposes. Only patrons
twenty (20) years of age or younger are allowed on all premises during
operating hours unless they are employees of said club, or a parent or legal
guardian of a patron. Nonprofit organizations shall be excluded upon proof of
tax exemption.
   (b)   Application: To obtain a youth dance license, the applicant shall file
an application with the City Clerk upon a form provided by said Clerk, which
shall contain, among other information, a petition signed by a majority of the
property owners, representing at least a majority of the frontage within three
hundred feet (300') in each direction of the proposed location on both sides of
the street on which the proposed location shall front, signifying their
willingness to have a license issued hereunder; providing that in any case if
the property owners of at least forty feet (40') of the property immediately
adjacent to or abutting on any side of the proposed location shall not appear
as signers on said petition, no license shall be issued hereunder. The approval
requirement of property owners and/or abutting owners can be waived under the
procedure set forth in subsection (j) of this section.
   (c)   Investigation: The City Clerk upon receipt of such application shall:
      (1)   Cause the Police Department to investigate all the statements
contained in each application to determine if the matters and things therein
are true.
      (2)   Cause the City's building inspectors, health inspectors and Fire
Department to inspect the proposed licensed premises to determine that said
premises comply with all City codes and are safe for occupancy as a dance club.
      (3)   If upon investigation the City Clerk shall be satisfied that the
matters and things therein contained in said application are true, and that the
applicant has complied with all the requirements thereof, and that the premises
to be licensed has complied with all City codes and is safe for occupancy, she
shall approve the same and upon receipt by the City Collector of the required
license fee, issue a license in accordance with the provisions herein.
   (d)   Fee: An annual license fee for such license shall be one hundred
dollars ($100.00), which shall be paid to the City Clerk. No license issued
herein shall be transferable or refunded.
   (e)   Term Of License: Youth dance licenses shall be in effect for a term of
one year and issued on May 1 of each year, expiring April 30 of the next year.
Prior to the reissuance of a license for an ensuing year, the requirements of
investigation as set forth in subsection (c) of this section shall again be
complied with by said licensee.
   (f)   Display Of License: Any person receiving a youth dance license under
the provisions of this section shall display said license prominently in the
licensed premises.
   (g)   Enforcement: The licensee or agent shall permit any police officer or
other official of the City free and unrestricted access to the licensed
premises for the purposes of inspecting the same.
   (h)   Violations And Penalties: The Chief of Police may suspend, or revoke
any youth dance license granted hereunder if, the operation of the licensed
premises is found to be detrimental to the health or safety of the
neighborhood, or if the licensee has been found to be guilty of the violation
of any City ordinance or State law in the operation of the licensed premises.
In addition thereto the Chief of Police may in lieu of a suspension or
revocation, impose a fine of up to one thousand five hundred dollars
($1,500.00) for any violation of this section or the laws of the State of
Illinois.
In addition to all other requirements for operation of a youth dance club
contained herein, no licensee hereunder shall allow any loitering, gathering of
unruly individuals or crowds, or any unlawful or dangerous behavior whether
inside of the premises or in any parking lot or other adjacent areas serving
the premises; and the licensee shall have the primary responsibility of hiring
adequate numbers of supervisory personnel as identified in subsection (m) of
this section, and taking other appropriate measures to observe compliance with
this subsection. In the event of a violation of the law has taken place, the
licensee or his agents shall immediately notify the Police Department.
   (i)   Appeal: Any person aggrieved by the decision of the Police Chief to
suspend, fine or revoke a license under this article shall have the right of
appeal. An appeal must be filed within fifteen (15) days after notice of
revocation by filing with the City Manager a letter of appeal briefly stating
therein the basis for the appeal. Failure to file a letter of appeal within the
said fifteen (15) days shall constitute a waiver of appellant's right to
review, but the City Manager, in his discretion, may nevertheless grant such
review. If the City Manager does not approve the decision of the Chief, he
shall transmit his decision to the Chief, who will comply with same.
   (j)   Waiver Of Approval Of Signature Requirement: The City Council may
waive the approval requirements relating to property owners and/or adjacent
owners set forth in subsection (b) of this section after holding a public
hearing concerning said matter at the request of an applicant for a youth dance
license. In the event the City Council determines that it is in the best
interest of the City that said waiver be granted then, in that event, the City
Council shall take official action thereon and refer said matter to the City
Clerk, who then may issue said license if all other requirements for the
issuance of said license have been complied with.
   (k)   Procedure For Waiver Of Approval: Any person that wants a waiver of
approval shall submit an appeal in writing to the City Clerk who will determine
the date of the public hearing in conjunction with the City Council. After said
date is determined, the following procedure shall be followed:
      (1)   A letter will be mailed to all adjacent property owners whose
signatures would normally be required for the approval of a youth dance license
application and said letter shall contain the name of the person appealing the
decision, the date of the public hearing, and instructions for the recipients
to file written objections, if any, and/or attend the public hearing in person.
These letters will be signed and mailed by the City Clerk who will also be the
designated person to receive any written responses relating to the appeal
process.
      (2)   The notice of appeal letters described above shall be deposited in
the U.S. mail at least two (2) weeks prior to the public hearing date and a
copy of said letter shall be furnished to the applicant.
      (3)   The City Clerk shall provide the City Council with a list of
persons to whom the letters are addressed, along with a copy of the form letter
which was mailed to said persons. The Clerk shall also provide a copy of the
written appeal and information concerning the youth dance license requested and
the result of compliance efforts made by the applicant to obtain the required
property owner's signature as set forth in this section. The City Clerk, upon
receipt of written objection(s) to appeal, if any are received, shall furnish
copies of said written objection(s) to the City Council, the applicant, and the
Rock Island Police Department
      (4)   The public hearing, on an appeal, will be held during a regular
City Council meeting using the same procedures at said meeting as followed by
other public hearings held in said Council.
      (5)   At the completion of the public hearing, the City Council will then
consider a motion as to whether or not to make a recommendation to the City
Clerk to waive the signature requirement of subsection (b) of this section.
   (l)   Hours Of Operation: All premises licensed under the provisions of this
section shall be closed between the hours of one o'clock (1:00) A.M. and six
o'clock (6:00) A.M. each day. It shall be the obligation of the owner or
operator of said youth dance facility to clear all patrons from the premises
fifteen (15) minutes after closing.
   (m)   Supervision: It shall be the obligation of the owner, lessee, manager,
officer or agent of said youth dance facility offering a dance to minors under
the age of twenty one (21) to provide one person twenty five (25) years or
older per each twenty (20) patrons to ensure proper supervision of said
premises. The person or persons provided for supervision shall not be inclusive
of anyone employed to dispense food, beverages, or other operational duties.
All adults who will be on site in the capacity of security or supervisory
personnel shall wear clothing which identifies them as security or supervisory
personnel. The owners shall also provide to the City Clerk the names and
addresses of any managers who will be on the premises during the club's hours
of operation.
   (n)   Curfew: The owner, lessee, manager, officer or agent of any youth
dance facility shall cause any minor patrons to be removed from said premises
one-half (1/2) hour prior to curfew hours regulated by State law. For the
purposes of this section, "curfew" shall be defined as: "It is unlawful for a
person less than seventeen (17) years of age to be present at or upon any
public assembly, building, place, street, or highway at the following times
unless accompanied and supervised by a parent, legal guardian, or other
responsible companion at least twenty-one (21) years of age approved by a
parent or legal guardian, or unless engaged in a business or occupation which
the laws of this State authorize a person less than seventeen (17) years of age
to perform: (1) Between 12:01 A.M. and 6:00 A.M., Saturday. (2) Between 12:01
A.M. and 6:00 A.M., Sunday. (3) Between 11:00 P.M. on Sunday to Thursday,
inclusive, and 6:00 A.M. on the following day". It is unlawful for a parent,
legal guardian or other person to knowingly permit a person in his custody or
control to violate this section.
   (o)   Insurance: All owners of a licensed youth dance club shall be required
to carry liability insurance with limits of liability in an amount of no less
than one million dollars ($1,000,000.00). The City of Rock Island, Illinois,
must be named as an additional insured under said policy and identified on the
owners' certificate of insurance. Proof of insurance under these conditions is
a prerequisite for the issuance or renewal of any youth dance club license.
(Ord. 084-2010, 12-20-2010)
